ie.dit.dt211.java
Class Calculator

java.lang.Object
  ie.dit.dt211.java.Calculator

public class Calculator
extends java.lang.Object

Simple backend for a radix 10 desktop calculator implemented using a variation of Dijkstra's shunting-yard algorithm

Method Detail

append

public boolean append(java.lang.String token)

Add a single infix input token to the calculator's pre-evaluation input. The caller is expected to call append() for an many input tokens that exist the the infix expression and then call finish() when done to indicate that the specified infix expression is complete and ready for evaluation.

The valid input tokens are as follows

  • Numeric digits [0-9] for specifying operands
  • Period [.] to specify the decimal point
  • Left and right parentheses [()] for specifying subexpressions
  • The negation operator [~] for specifying a negative sign on a subsequent operand
  • Arithmetic operators [+-x/] specifying add, subtract, multiply and divide respectively

Parameters:
token - A string specifying an input token
Returns:
true if the specified input token is a valid next token for the current pre-evaluation input token stream, i.e. it would be legal for infix notation and false otherwise

finish

public void finish()

Indicate that the currently specified infix input stream is complete and is ready for evaluation. It can be used as in the following example to test if the already input tokens are valid and, if so, obtain the expression result.

Example:

        Calculator calc = new Calculator();
        .
        .
        .
        try {
                calc.finish();
                double result = calc.evaluate();
        } catch (IllegalStateException e) {
                // Handle error
        }

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the already-specified input tokens do not represent a complete and valid infix expression

evaluate

public double evaluate()
Evaluate the current infix expression. Assumes that a number of append() calls and a finish() call have preceded

Returns:
floating-point result

reset

public void reset()
Reset the calculator, preparing it for a new infix input stream. Discards any current state.

isArithmeticOperator

public static boolean isArithmeticOperator(java.lang.String op)
Tests if the specified input token is a valid arithmetic operator in this calculator

Parameters:
op - the input token to text
Returns:
true if valid, false otherwise
